intro: Antilla parvula, commonly known as the small antilla, is a small flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows up to 30 centimeters in height, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Antilla parvula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in a garden setting.
